etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 呙(呙) (guō, "sound" or variant) used for phonetic value -> sound or speech-related meaning
etymology.interpretation: The character 咼(咼) (guō) utilizes the radical 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") indicating a meaning related to sound or speech, and the component 呙(呙) (guō) serves as the phonetic guide.

examples.chinese: 学者讨论咼字的起源(學者討論咼字的起源)，认为它源自古汉语(認為它源自古漢語)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě tǎolùn guō zì de qǐyuán, rènwéi tā yuánzì gǔ hànyǔ.
examples.english: Scholars discuss the origin of the character guō, believing it originates from Old Chinese.

examples.chinese: 古籍中咼字被频繁使用(古籍中咼字被頻繁使用)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔjí zhōng guō zì bèi pínfán shǐyòng.
examples.english: In ancient texts, the character guō was frequently used.
